title: Chapter One
description: Hoffman & Associates takes on hot new case.

title: Chapter Two
description: Hoffman defends second man for Jessica's murder.

title: Chapter Three
description: Jessica's diary is turned over to Hoffman.

title: Chapter Four
description: Neil Avedon takes a polygraph test.

title: Chapter Five
description: Julie's life may be in danger.

title: Chapter Six
description: Julie overdoses on drugs prescribed by Dr. Lester.

title: Chapter Seven
description: Hoffman questions a nurse about call from Neil Avedon.

title: Chapter Eight
description: Julie meets another of Dr. Lester's female patients.

title: Chapter Ten
description: Hoffman faces a dangerous fan of Avedon.

title: Chapter Eleven
description: Hoffman becomes more suspicious of Cross

title: Chapter Twelve
description: A member of Hoffman's family is abducted.

title: Chapter Thirteen
description: Elizabeth identifies her abductor.

title: Chapter Fourteen
description: Evidence comes to light proving Richard Cross lied.

title: Chapter Fifteen
description: The murder trial is halted.

title: Chapter Sixteen
description: Hoffman is stunned when Julie takes the stand.

title: Chapter Seventeen
description: A connection is uncovered between Cross and Dr. Lester's nurse.

title: Chapter Eighteen
description: Hoffman learns of Justine's involvement with Cross.

title: Chapter Nineteen
description: Cross acts strangely on the witness stand.

title: Chapter Twenty
description: Justine discovers the cause of Cross' erratic behavior.

title: Chapter Twenty-Three
description: The missing tape is discovered.

title: Chapter One, Year Two
description: Deputy District Attorney Jimmy Wyler joins Hoffman & Associates, and for his first case he defends Sharon Rooney, who was arrested for murdering the governor of California.

title: Chapter Two, Year Two
description: Sharon testifies she was pregnant with Governor Van Allan's child, but he made her have an abortion, while Wyler learns the governor's wife was having an affair of her own.

title: Chapter Three, Year Two
description: As Sharon continues to insist she is guilty, Wyler feels certain that she is not, and a surprising source offers to pay for Sharon Rooney's defense.

title: Chapter Four, Year Two
description: Wyler talks to Sharon's husband concerning her confession, then later meets basketball superstar Rickey Latrell, who fears he'll be arrested for the murder of an NBA team owner.

title: Chapter Five, Year Two
description: Wyler learns another of the governor's affairs ended badly for the woman involved, and Latrell is called in for questioning concerning the murder of team owner Sandy Fortas.

title: Chapter Six, Year Two
description: While Wyler uncovers more connections between the various players involved in the Van Allan murder, Rickey Latrell is arrested and charged with murder.

title: Chapter Seven, Year Two
description: Sharon has trouble dealing with the jury's verdict, and an underworld figure already in jail promises to tell Wyler what really happened the night the governor was killed.

title: Chapter Eight, Year Two
description: The truth about the governor's murder is finally revealed as Mosley and Docknovich argue over who is best suited to make Rickey Latrell's bail argument.

title: Chapter Nine, Year Two
description: While Docknovich and Mosley clash over jury selection for the Latrell case, an agent eager to represent Latrell implies that his current agent has been stealing from clients.

title: Chapter Ten, Year Two
description: Witnesses in the Latrell case portray Rickey as a desperate and possessive man, but later it is Rickey himself who offers up the most damning statement.
